terms.definition: Quality Assurance - the systematic process of ensuring that products or services meet specified requirements and standards
A software system designed to create, manage, store, and share technical documents and knowledge resources in a centralized location
A system that tracks and manages changes to documents or code over time, allowing users to see revision history and revert to previous versions
The ability for multiple users to simultaneously work on and edit the same document with changes visible instantly to all participants
A unified system where all documentation is stored in a single, accessible location rather than scattered across multiple platforms or files
Pre-designed document formats that provide a standardized structure and layout for creating consistent documentation
The ability to track and document the history, application, or location of an item or process through recorded identification
Software or services that are hosted on remote servers and accessed via the internet rather than installed locally on individual computers
Enterprise Resource Planning - integrated software systems that manage and automate core business processes across an organization
The documented verification that a manufacturing or business process consistently produces results that meet predetermined specifications
Records and documents that demonstrate adherence to industry standards, regulations, and legal requirements
The process of connecting different software systems or tools so they can share data and work together seamlessly
The state of having all necessary documentation and processes properly organized and accessible for regulatory or compliance reviews
The use of software to automatically execute repetitive tasks and processes without manual intervention
The degree to which information is correct, complete, and free from errors or inconsistencies
